intro: Hieracium orthostypum, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium orthostypum is often found in open habitats and is adapted to thrive in temperate climates.
